claim: If Codebase Community had automatically suggested alternative tags at the time of posting, 'Mark Meckes' would have chosen the tag <literature> for at least one post with zero comments.
extra_info: used by Mark Meckes refers to DisplayName = 'Mark Meckes'; Doen't have comments refers to CommentCount = 0;
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim. It speculates about what Mark Meckes 'would have chosen' if a hypothetical feature (automatic tag suggestions) had existed. The database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under imagined circumstances. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from a database.

content.text:
This claim describes a hypothetical "what if" scenario: "If Codebase Community had automatically suggested alternative tags at the time of posting, 'Mark Meckes' would have chosen the tag <literature>..."

This is a counterfactual claim. It speculates about what would have happened under different circumstances (an automatic tag suggestion feature that didn't exist). The database only records what actually happened, not what users would have done under hypothetical conditions. No SQL query can verify what a user "would have chosen" in an imagined scenario.
